meanings.definition: To be thrifty or frugal in spending money.
meanings.sent1: She scrimped on her daily expenses to save money for a vacation.
meanings.sent2: He always scrimped on unnecessary purchases to build his savings.
meanings.sent3: The family scrimped on eating out to afford a fun day at the amusement park.
meanings.sent4: She scrimped every penny, like a squirrel saving nuts for winter.
meanings.sent5: Scrimping on small luxuries allowed her to achieve her financial goals.

meanings.definition: To save or economize on something, especially money.
meanings.sent1: The students scrimped on snacks to have enough money for the school trip.
meanings.sent2: They scrimped on decorations to allocate more funds to charity.
meanings.sent3: The couple scrimped on movie tickets to afford a fancy dinner.
meanings.sent4: Scrimping on electricity bills was their way of being environmentally conscious.
meanings.sent5: Scrimping on time wasted helped them achieve their project deadline.

meanings.definition: To cut down on expenses or be frugal in managing resources.
meanings.sent1: The company scrimped on office supplies to balance the budget.
meanings.sent2: They scrimped on travel costs by carpooling to work.
meanings.sent3: The team scrimped on coffee breaks to finish the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent4: Scrimping on unnecessary meetings improved productivity in the office.
meanings.sent5: Scrimping on distractions allowed them to focus on their goals.
